author: martinc
msg: Update the docs to deprecate the name, type and scope attributes of the
form tag.

author: martinc
msg: Swatted another one.

author: martinc
msg: Reinstate the use of the name, type and scope attributes for backwards
compatibility with Struts 1.0.x. (These will be deprecated in the docs,
though.)
Clean up usage of attribute values so that they are always initialised and
reset to null, and never modified by the tag handler. Get rid of the hacky
save/restore code which was previously added to work around tag reuse
issues.
Submitted by: Marco La Porta, David M. Karr

author: martinc
msg: Fix lots of indentation inconsistencies that were bugging me, and add some
missing braces around 'if' statements. No real code changes.

author: craigmcc
msg: Equip DispatchAction with a new method -- unspecified() -- that is called
if the request does not include a value for the request parameter used to
select the method to be dispatched to.  Subclasses can easily override this
method to provide appropriate default behavior.
If not overridden, unspecified() does what was previously hard coded if the
method name was null:  send an HTTP "Bad Request" response.
PR: Bugzilla #11283
Submitted by:	Dylan van Iersel <dylan at van-iersel.org>
